TopicTitle: There is something very wrong with Valentina...

Articles.Content:
She is the Kraken!

And consists mainly of rubber, it seems.

<iframe width="480" height="270" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/djAa9-8NVZU?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="true"></iframe>

That seems to be a fairly common bug with ragdoll physics. Ever play Fallout 3? Occasionally some of the baddies you killed would go nuts like that. Except worse. And they'd persist until the cell reset itself.

ETA Video:

<iframe width="459" height="344" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/PP6OLbaz5GU?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="true"></iframe>

**Edited <time datetime="2015-04-29T20:54:28Z" title="04/29/2015 08:54  PM" data-short="9 yr">April 29, 2015</time> by Sidereus**

Talk about crazy physics ... [Vanoss & crew & the 4-man sled](https://youtu.be/a91AA9YbHmU). (*foul language warning*)

**Edited <time datetime="2015-04-29T21:07:03Z" title="04/29/2015 09:07  PM" data-short="9 yr">April 29, 2015</time> by LordFerret**
Rip in peace

> 
> Rip in peace

Nope, she survived. Rode back to the lander on her EVA pack and got into orbit safely. Because Val is badass!
Maybe she was just brakedancing ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)
The probably thought that the rubber-variant of the standard spacehelmet looked more fashionable...

> 
> Maybe she was just brakedancing ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)

It's only in the KSP forums that you can get away with "brakedancing" ...

> 
> Maybe she was just brakedancing ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)

Kraken dancing?

Guys, all kerbals do that. They've always done that.

I have screenshots somewhere of a kerbal reentering really fast and turning into a green noodle monster kraken thing. (seriously this kerbal was probably at least 7-8 meters wide from stretching)

Jeb has done this tto.

Valentina isn't THE Kraken, she's being ATTACKED BY the Kraken.

> 
> Jeb has done this tto.
> Valentina isn't THE Kraken, she's being ATTACKED BY the Kraken.

even better, the kraken is manifesting inside of her and it's visible through her kraken like appearance. ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)

There needs to be a legit video about this. Some CSI stuff. but you call it KSI, Kraken Scene Investigation.
Watch Danny2462's "Messing Around in Kerbal Space Program 4 or 5" the intro has a kerbal doing exactly this

Yesterday, on Mun, Valentina climbed the space just between the last decoupler and the heat shield of the pod. She passed throught the pod and the decoupler and the main pod was uncap ![;.;](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cry.gif)... Bad day...

**Edited <time datetime="2015-04-30T15:14:52Z" title="04/30/2015 03:14  PM" data-short="9 yr">April 30, 2015</time> by Herr Rictus Bingo**
I guess we need a space exorcism!

That's not that bad though.

The first time I loaded up 1.0; and did my first launch ever with the Flea and mk1 pod... I EVA'd val, she went kerthunk against the pod when getting out. I climbed down the pod (nothing on the bottom of the pod). On land, and she died; for no reason. Said she impacted kerbin. Good thing I didn't have reverts disabled; or the first EVA would have been her last.

The kerthunk when EVAing is unnerving to say the least.

Pffft, Amateurs

[![9071B844C49BE7BAC40BE7CBE677690609497CD3](http://images.akamai.steamusercontent.com/ugc/433776474674993758/9071B844C49BE7BAC40BE7CBE677690609497CD3/)](https://youtu.be/Hpckm_Z9duQ?t=15s)
You lot ever get the one when the ragdoll *sticks* that way? You end up running about like a fool, with your limbs stretched and kinked. Jump, and it *gets worse*Ã¢â‚¬â€¹. Glorious.
You are a cruel, cruel man ShadowZone, but this was too funny *not* to stick for May ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

That's nothing. Try watching the intro to

<iframe width="480" height="270" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/htQm-Nbtw24?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="true"></iframe>
, or even better, [THIS ONE](https://youtu.be/a0JtdvVJ_mU?t=26s), courtesy of Danny2462.
I remember shooting a guy that was on a balcony in COD4, he fell but got stuck by his feet, then suddenly he began to stretch himself and shake like a strutless rocket.
